messages.title: Securing the recovery, not putting it at risk
messages.content: Faced with a national financial crisis, Labour was not prepared just to let the recession take its course. Labour chose to fight back, with bold action to stabilise the banking system and set a course for economic recovery.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Secure the recovery and reduce the deficit through economic growth, fair taxes, and cuts to lower priority spending.

Raise family living standards, keeping mortgage rates low, increasing tax credits for families with young children, providing new help for first-time buyers, and restore the link between the state pension and earnings from 2012.

Build a high tech economy, supporting businesses and industry to create 1 million more skilled jobs and modernising our infrastructure with High-Speed Rail, a Green Investment Bank, and broadband access for all.
Protect frontline investment in policing, schools, childcare, and the NHS, with a new guarantee of cancer test results within a week.

Strengthen fairness in communities through an Australian style points-based system to control immigration; guaranteed education, apprenticeships, and jobs for young people; and a crackdown on anti-social behaviour.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour is as well placed as the Lib-Dems to take on the Conservatives in Chelmsford.

issues.economy: Securing a secure economic future for Britain that can be sustained, using the potential of all people, not just a few. Britain must rebuild and balance its economy on sound foundations to build economic growth and create the jobs of the future.
issues.health: Protect frontline investment in ... the NHS ...
issues.immigration: Strengthen fairness in communities through an Australian style points-based system to control immigration.
issues.socialWelfare: Raise family living standards ... providing new help for first-time buyers, and restore the link between the state pension and earnings from 2012.

housing.content: Raise family living standards, keeping mortgage rates as low as possible; ... new help for first-time buyers...

leaflet.personalStatement: Labour candidate Pete Dixon's main message to the people of Chelmsford is: This Labour government is good for fairness, good for families-and good for Britain - please think carefully – don't let it slip away.

quotes.text: Remember the Tory recessions of the 80's and 90's when unemployment was allowed to reach over 3 million with record home repossessions! Remember the double figure mortgage rates!

images.caption: Bar chart showing the results of the last general election in Chelmsford.
Photo of Labour candidate Pete Dixon.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Ignore the false figures put out by the Lib-Dems. Labour is as well placed as the Lib-Dems to take on the Conservatives in Chelmsford.
